Google parent company Alphabet and Facebook both tumbled more than 6 percent, and Amazon dropped close to 5 percent on reports that the Justice Department and Federal Trade Commission are.

title: Facebook keeps three-yearly 'say on pay' vote, amid outside investor doubts
text: Facebook Inc investors will only get to vote on the pay of Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg every three years, rather than annually as most outside shareholders would prefer, according to a vote tally released by the world's largest social media company late on Monday, following its annual meeting last week.
